meanings.definition: To change in form or nature
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar will metamorphose into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: The tadpole will metamorphose into a frog.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if my old toy can metamorphose into something new.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas began to metamorphose into a groundbreaking invention.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion caused the pumpkin to metamorphose into a carriage.

meanings.sent1: The ugly duckling will metamorphose into a beautiful swan.
meanings.sent2: The chrysalis will metamorphose into a butterfly.
meanings.sent3: It's like watching a caterpillar metamorphose into a fashion model.
meanings.sent4: The barren land began to metamorphose into a lush garden.
meanings.sent5: The ordinary girl seemed to metamorphose into a princess before our eyes.

meanings.definition: To evolve or develop into something different
meanings.sent1: The small acorn will metamorphose into a mighty oak tree.
meanings.sent2: The tadpole will metamorphose into a frog.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar seemed to metamorphose into a tiny superhero.
meanings.sent4: His simple idea would metamorphose into a global phenomenon.
meanings.sent5: The plain caterpillar began to metamorphose into a colorful butterfly.
